{i} '''Note to editors:'''

You are more than welcome to contribute!<<BR>>
 · If you change any formatting, please do so consistently.<<BR>>
 · Always provide references to back up EoL dates.<<BR>>
 · A flavours' support period is defined by both Ubuntu's generic release announcement and that of the  flavour - if they do not match, point it out, use what the flavour last announced.<<BR>>
 · When EoL dates / support periods change:<<BR>>
   · Always list the currently valid EoL date only.<<BR>>
   · Document (notes and references) both initial support period and any change announcements<<BR>>
   · Reducing support periods below earlier announcements should not be possible, point it out where it happens<<BR>>
Thank you!

</pre>

== End of Life Dates ==

'End of life (EoL)' is when a software reaches the end of its designated support period. When this happens varies across Ubuntu, Ubuntu&nbsp;flavours&nbsp;[] and different releases, so we are gathering this information here to have a central reference for volunteer support efforts.

----

{i} '''Please note!'''

'''See the official <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/Releases|Releases]]</nowiki> page for Ubuntu EoL dates.'''

The page you are looking at now is a volunteer driven community effort. '''None of the information provided here is to be understood as official or legally binding announcements by Canonical, the Ubuntu project or any Ubuntu flavours.'''
